intro: Dendranthema crassum, commonly known as the French daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, hairy leaves and white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Dendranthema crassum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
